entry.title: Blasphemous Rumors
entry.summary:
Author: Fluffmonster69

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,097Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 22

Summary: Inspired by the events of Batman: Gotham By Gaslight (1989) Bruce Wayne is on trial, believed to be Jack the Ripper after the serial murders follow him from London to Gotham. Clark Kent is sent to report on the trial and the week leading to Bruce's execution. He is unnerved by Bruce, who's appearance and demeanor have drastically changed, however upon arriving back in Gotham a day after the trial Clark is greeted with the city in uproar. Bruce Wayne has escaped his imprisonment and criminals start cropping up half dead covered in identical puncture wounds. Clark sets out to find Bruce as Superman, finding instead a monster lurking in the shadows of Gotham's streets.*Tags and warnings may change.Updates once a week :)

entry.title: Where the Birds Used to Sing
entry.summary:
Author: That_One_Computer_Geek (T1CG)

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,029Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 70

Summary: “You’re the Batman,” Clark said, trying to keep his voice warm, even. “I’ve heard about you.” Still no response. The wings shifted slightly, the sound low and dry, like wind moving through bone. Even folded, they loomed. Easily twelve, maybe fourteen feet in total wingspan. The joints flexed with subtle micromovements, like the Bat was resisting the urge to spring forward or flee. And the texture… rough, almost scaly, with no sign of feathers. All tendon and membrane. Like something prehistoric. Clark felt a shiver crawl down his spine. It wasn’t fear. Not exactly. “I’ve been looking for you,” he said, taking a cautious step forward, hands open at his sides. “Not you you, I mean. Others like me. Metas. People doing the right thing on their own terms.” No answer. “I thought you’d be taller,” he added, offering a small grin. Nothing. Not even a twitch. “Or… less grim.” Or, Bruce's time over the years, gaining children, loosing them, joining the JL, all while the JL is under the impression that the man in the batsuit is some sort of cryptid.

entry.title: With All Due Respect
entry.summary:
Author: BlueGrapefruitSoda

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 31,147Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 184

Summary: Bruce gave a slight smile, his voice low and curiosity piqued. “You have permission to speak.” Clark shifted uncomfortably, his gaze dropping to the ground. “As someone who’s dedicated his life to your safety and happiness,” he began, his voice quiet but steady, “it matters deeply to me that you choose a partner truly worthy of you — someone who honors your love and your loyalty.” He drew in a slow breath, then lifted his eyes to meet Bruce’s. “And I’m afraid, my prince… the man you’re considering is not that person.”Or Clark is in love with Bruce, the prince he protects and Bruce is oblivious.

entry.title: The Buttered Cat Paradox
entry.summary:
Author: writersagainstwritersblock

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 44,368Chapters: 17/?Kudos: 553

Summary: “No comment.”“You don’t know what I was going to ask,” Clark said with a hint of a smile. “Maybe I just wanted to congratulate you on catching the Film Freak.”Bruce gave him a flat look.“Or maybe I think I can help.”“With a case of vandalism?”Clark stepped in front of him. “It’s not vandalism and you know it, detective.”“And what makes you say that?”“If it were vandalism it would be something a lot more juvenile. To the point. It wouldn’t claim there were seventeen missing kids. That’s public outcry.”“Is that so?”“That and I tried to do a story on the growing number of homeless children last month and I got shut down. According to the last count, the numbers have been decreasing, but there’s been no change in policies, no extra funding to CPS, or shelters, or even an increase in the number of inmates in the juvenile detention center. So where are they going?” Detective Bruce Wayne may have the highest solve rate in Gotham, but if he wants to solve this case, he’ll need the help of an elusive street kid, and while Dick Grayson always lands on his feet, he usually lands himself right into trouble.

entry.title: who's your type?
entry.summary:
Author: mikaminato

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,839Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 153

Summary: "Okay, that's it." Tim hits the pause button. "This conversation is stupid and pointless.""I agree." Jason crosses his arms. "I mean, it's not like B will do something about his serious blue balls situation any time soon. He'll just keep up the whole "emotionally constipated" charade because he's already committed to this city and being an old, emotionally stunted grump for life.""Harsh, Jay." Dick laughs. "We should set up a date night for him or something."(Or, Jason, Dick, Tim, and Damian each had their own idea of what Bruce's type was. Turns out, they were all wrong.)
